activities.title: CAP Dilemma Debate
activities.desc: Present 3 real systems (Amazon, Google Docs, Cassandra). Ask: which CAP properties do they sacrifice and why? Small groups debate, then share out.

activities.title: Load Estimation Worksheet
activities.desc: Give a scenario (e.g. a food delivery app). Students estimate RPS, bandwidth, and storage using back-of-envelope math. Walk through solution together.

activities.title: Cache Strategy Card Sort
activities.desc: Print cards describing scenarios. Students match each to read-through / write-through / write-back and justify the choice.

activities.title: 1-Minute Architecture Sketch
activities.desc: Pose a simple system prompt (e.g. URL shortener). Students sketch a component diagram + API endpoints in 5 minutes, then peer-review.

activities.title: Requirements Treasure Hunt
activities.desc: Show a vague product brief ('Build a messaging app'). Students must extract hidden non-functional requirements buried in the description.

activities.title: API Contract Design
activities.desc: Students design REST endpoints, pagination, and versioning for a given feature. Compare schemas and discuss trade-offs.

activities.title: SLO Definition Workshop
activities.desc: Given a fintech app scenario, teams define SLOs for latency, availability, and error rate. Present and critique each other's targets.

activities.title: Exit Quiz: NFRs
activities.desc: 5-question rapid quiz: identify whether each requirement is functional or non-functional. Includes tricky edge cases.

activities.title: Traffic Routing Simulation
activities.desc: Use sticky notes on a whiteboard as 'requests'. Physically route them through L4 and L7 nodes. Visualize what gets dropped during a node failure.

activities.title: CI/CD Pipeline Flowchart
activities.desc: Students draw a complete CI/CD pipeline from commit to production, labeling each stage, artifact store, and rollback trigger.

activities.title: Rollback Scenario Drill
activities.desc: Present a bad deploy scenario. Students must identify the rollback strategy, estimate blast radius, and write the incident checklist.

activities.title: Nginx Config Review
activities.desc: Share a simplified Nginx config with 2 bugs. Students spot, explain, and fix the issues.

activities.title: Read vs Write Heavy Challenge
activities.desc: Show 4 real apps (Twitter, Bank, Netflix, WhatsApp). Classify each as read-heavy / write-heavy / both and explain the consequences.

activities.title: Sharding Strategy Design
activities.desc: Given a social media schema, students choose user-based vs region-based sharding, draw the shard map, and identify hotspot risks.

activities.title: Cache Invalidation Puzzle
activities.desc: Scenario: cached data goes stale. Students must trace the invalidation path and redesign the cache layer to prevent re-occurrence.

activities.title: DB Design Critique
activities.desc: Show a flawed DB schema. Students write a short critique covering indexing, normalization, and scalability concerns.

activities.title: Consistent Hashing Ring Demo
activities.desc: Use a physical ring (whiteboard circle) and sticky note 'nodes'. Add/remove nodes and see how keys redistribute. Count moves with/without virtual nodes.

activities.title: Quorum Calculator
activities.desc: Students calculate read quorum, write quorum, and fault tolerance for N=5, 7, 9 node clusters. Explore the R+W>N rule.

activities.title: Consistency Level Trade-off Table
activities.desc: Create a 3-column table: scenario, recommended consistency level, justification. Fill in 6 real-world scenarios.

activities.title: Gossip Protocol Trace
activities.desc: Given a 6-node cluster with partial updates, trace how gossip spreads. Identify when all nodes converge.

activities.title: Sync vs Async War Stories
activities.desc: Start with a real outage story (e.g. a sync API cascade failure). Ask: how would async messaging have prevented this?

activities.title: Kafka Architecture Diagram
activities.desc: Students draw a Kafka setup from scratch: topics, partitions, producers, consumers, consumer groups, and offsets for an e-commerce order system.

activities.title: Message Ordering Challenge
activities.desc: Scenario: an order system needs strict message ordering per user but high parallelism overall. Students design the partition key strategy.

activities.title: Alert Pipeline Design
activities.desc: Design an alert pipeline from metrics ingestion to notification. Must specify queue, processing, deduplication, and delivery stages.

activities.title: Google Search Reverse-Engineering
activities.desc: Search for the same query 3 different ways. Compare results. Hypothesize: what signals might influence the ranking?

activities.title: Inverted Index Builder
activities.desc: Manually build an inverted index for 5 short documents. Perform a multi-term query and trace the lookup path.

activities.title: Query Optimization Lab
activities.desc: Given a slow search query plan, students rewrite it using filter-first, scoring optimization, and caching strategies.

activities.title: Architecture Review: E-commerce Search
activities.desc: Sketch a full search system for an e-commerce site covering ingest, index, query, and cache layers.

activities.title: How Dropbox Works? Guess It!
activities.desc: Before the lesson, students sketch how they think Dropbox stores files. After the lesson, compare original sketch with real architecture.

activities.title: Chunking & Dedup Exercise
activities.desc: Given 3 files with overlapping content, manually apply content-addressed chunking and calculate storage savings from deduplication.

activities.title: Multi-Region Sync Design
activities.desc: Design cross-region sync for a file storage system: handle conflict resolution, bandwidth cost, and consistency.

activities.title: Metadata DB Schema
activities.desc: Design a metadata DB for a cloud storage system covering file versioning, chunk references, and access control.

activities.title: DNS Detective
activities.desc: Run `nslookup` on 5 different popular domains. Compare TTLs, IP counts, and response types. What patterns do you notice?

activities.title: DNS Resolution Walkthrough
activities.desc: Physically act out a DNS resolution: one student is the browser, others are resolver, root, TLD, and authoritative servers. Pass paper 'queries' between roles.

activities.title: TTL Trade-off Analysis
activities.desc: Given 3 scenarios (marketing site, banking API, streaming CDN), choose the ideal TTL and justify: cache freshness vs resolver load.

activities.title: DNS Load Balancing Plan
activities.desc: Design a DNS-based load balancing strategy for a global app with users in 3 regions. Cover geo-routing, health checks, and failover.

activities.title: The Double-Booking Problem
activities.desc: Act out a hotel booking scenario with 2 clients booking the last room simultaneously. What goes wrong without locks? Brainstorm solutions first.

activities.title: Fencing Token Diagram
activities.desc: Draw the fencing token flow: client acquires lock, sends token, storage validates. Then show what happens when a stale client ignores the fence.

activities.title: Redlock Analysis
activities.desc: Walk through Redis Redlock on N=5 nodes. Calculate: majority quorum, failure scenarios, and clock skew risks.

activities.title: Lock Design Decision
activities.desc: 3 scenarios (payment deduction, seat reservation, leader election). Choose and justify the right locking strategy for each.

activities.title: Bank Transfer Gone Wrong
activities.desc: Simulate a money transfer where the debit succeeds but credit fails. Walk through the disaster and ask: what should have happened?

activities.title: 2PC Phase Diagram
activities.desc: Students draw the 2PC protocol with coordinator + 2 participants, labeling prepare, commit, abort, and failure paths.

activities.title: Idempotency Key Design
activities.desc: Design idempotency for a payment API: define the key structure, storage, expiry, and duplicate detection logic.

activities.title: Saga vs 2PC Comparison
activities.desc: Given 2 scenarios, students choose between Saga and 2PC, and write a 1-paragraph justification for each.

activities.title: BitTorrent In The Room
activities.desc: Simulate a file share using sticky note 'chunks'. Students must find peers, request chunks, and reassemble the file. Feel how P2P works.

activities.title: DHT Key Lookup
activities.desc: Build a simple Kademlia-style DHT on paper: place nodes on a keyspace, route a lookup step-by-step using XOR distance.

activities.title: Churn Simulation
activities.desc: Given a 10-node P2P network, randomly remove 3 nodes. Show how the system re-routes, replicates, and heals.

activities.title: P2P Design Brief
activities.desc: Design a P2P video streaming network. Cover discovery, chunk distribution, NAT traversal, and abuse prevention.

activities.title: Real-World Object Hunt
activities.desc: Pick 3 objects from your daily life. Model them as classes with attributes, methods, and relationships. Which OOP principle does each embody?

activities.title: UML Class Diagram: Library System
activities.desc: Students draw a complete UML class diagram for a library: Book, Member, Loan — with multiplicity, access modifiers, and relationships.

activities.title: Sequence Diagram Trace
activities.desc: Trace the sequence of a user checking out a book: draw lifelines, messages, and return arrows for all participants.

activities.title: Aggregation vs Composition Quiz
activities.desc: 10 relationship examples. Students label each as aggregation, composition, association, or inheritance with a one-line reason.

activities.title: Pattern Scavenger Hunt
activities.desc: Open any popular open-source library. Find and name at least 2 creational patterns used in the codebase. Share findings.

activities.title: Builder vs Constructor Comparison
activities.desc: Implement a Pizza class: first with a telescoping constructor, then with Builder. Count parameters and compare readability.

activities.title: Singleton Anti-pattern Lab
activities.desc: Given a broken Singleton with thread-safety issues, students identify the race condition and fix it using double-checked locking.

activities.title: Pattern Identification MCQ
activities.desc: 6 code snippets — identify which creational pattern each uses and what problem it solves.

activities.title: Code Smell Gallery Walk
activities.desc: Post 5 code snippets around the room (or screen). Students rotate and annotate each with the SOLID principle being violated.

activities.title: Refactor to SOLID
activities.desc: Give a bloated God class. Students refactor it step-by-step: extract responsibilities, invert dependencies, and segregate interfaces.

activities.title: LSP Litmus Test
activities.desc: Show 5 inheritance hierarchies. Students apply the Liskov test: 'Can I replace the parent with this child without breaking behavior?'

activities.title: Design Review Memo
activities.desc: Provide a 50-line class. Students write a short review identifying SOLID violations and proposing fixes.

activities.title: Real-World Pattern Mapping
activities.desc: Match each structural pattern to a real-world analog: Adapter = power plug converter, Facade = car dashboard... Students come up with their own.

activities.title: Decorator Chain Builder
activities.desc: Build a text formatter: plain → bold → italic → underline using the Decorator pattern. Show how decorators stack without modifying originals.

activities.title: Adapter Design Challenge
activities.desc: Given a legacy payment API and a new interface contract, design an Adapter that bridges them. Map each method and handle mismatches.

activities.title: Pattern Selection Justification
activities.desc: 3 scenarios. Students choose the correct structural pattern and write a 2-sentence justification for each choice.

activities.title: Strategy vs Hard-coding
activities.desc: Show a sorting function with 4 if/else branches. Refactor live into Strategy. Count how many lines changed — and how many didn't.

activities.title: Observer Pattern Simulation
activities.desc: Students model a notification system: one 'publisher' posts events, multiple 'subscribers' react differently. Draw the event flow and observer registration.

activities.title: Command + Undo Implementation
activities.desc: Design a text editor's undo/redo using Command pattern. Implement execute(), undo(), and a command history stack.

activities.title: Pattern Refactoring Task
activities.desc: Given monolithic event handling code, refactor it using Observer or Command with a brief explanation of the design decision.

activities.title: State Machine Exploration
activities.desc: Map out the states of a vending machine or traffic light on a whiteboard. Students discover they've drawn a State pattern without being told.

activities.title: State Transition Diagram
activities.desc: Design a full State Machine for an order lifecycle: pending → confirmed → shipped → delivered → returned, with allowed transitions.

activities.title: Chain of Responsibility Design
activities.desc: Design a support ticket escalation: L1 → L2 → Manager → CEO. Implement handler chaining, early exit, and fallback.

activities.title: Transaction Flow Modeling
activities.desc: Model a payment transaction state machine with success, failure, retry, and timeout states. Include transitions and guard conditions.

activities.title: Dining Philosophers Live
activities.desc: 5 students, 5 pencils, 5 plates of 'food'. Simulate the Dining Philosophers problem. Who deadlocks first? Then find the fix.

activities.title: Mutex vs Semaphore Showdown
activities.desc: Design 2 scenarios: one needs mutual exclusion, one needs resource counting. Implement both and explain why each choice is correct.

activities.title: Thread Pool Sizing Calculator
activities.desc: Given CPU-bound vs I/O-bound workloads, calculate optimal thread pool size using Little's Law and benchmark assumptions.

activities.title: Deadlock Detection Drill
activities.desc: Show 3 code snippets with concurrent resource acquisition. Identify which causes a deadlock and rewrite to fix it.

activities.title: Feature Request Chaos
activities.desc: Start with a simple discount calculator. Add 5 new requirements one by one. Watch the code collapse without extensibility. Then redesign.

activities.title: Polymorphic Discount Engine
activities.desc: Design a discount system using polymorphism: PercentageDiscount, FixedDiscount, BuyOneGetOne. Add a new type without touching existing code.

activities.title: Board Game Domain Model
activities.desc: Model a board game engine (Chess or Checkers): pieces, moves, validation rules — designed for extensibility to new game types.

activities.title: Extensibility Checklist Review
activities.desc: Review a provided design. Score it on: OCP compliance, polymorphism use, coupling level, ease of adding features. Give a 1-5 score with justification.

activities.title: ORM vs Raw SQL Debate
activities.desc: Show the same query in ORM and raw SQL. Discuss: when does each shine? Where does ORM abstraction break down?

activities.title: Repository Pattern Implementation
activities.desc: Implement UserRepository with CRUD methods behind an interface. Show how the service layer never touches the DB directly.

activities.title: Transaction Boundary Design
activities.desc: Given a multi-step order creation flow (create order + deduct stock + charge payment), define transaction boundaries and rollback logic.

activities.title: Layered Architecture Review
activities.desc: Diagram a feature request end-to-end: Controller → Service → Repository → DB. Identify any layer violations or leaky abstractions.

activities.title: HTTP Status Code Roulette
activities.desc: Call 10 real public APIs with bad inputs. Log the status codes returned. Vote on which ones are correct, misleading, or lazy.

activities.title: Error Handling Framework Design
activities.desc: Design a global error handler: map exceptions to HTTP codes, define error response schema, and handle validation vs business vs infra errors differently.

activities.title: Rate Limiting Algorithm Comparison
activities.desc: Implement token bucket and leaky bucket on paper for the same traffic pattern. Compare burst behavior and smoothness.

activities.title: API Design Audit
activities.desc: Review a provided REST API spec. Identify: missing validation, wrong status codes, unclear error messages, and security gaps.

activities.title: WTF/Minute Code Review
activities.desc: Display notoriously messy code. Students count their 'WTFs per minute' as a humorous proxy for code quality. Then identify fixes.

activities.title: Refactoring Kata
activities.desc: Give a working but messy function (e.g. a billing calculator). Students refactor it in stages: rename → extract → split → test-name → simplify.

activities.title: Peer Code Review Round
activities.desc: Exchange code snippets with a partner. Write a structured code review covering: naming, cohesion, complexity, and testability.

activities.title: Before/After Explanation
activities.desc: Show a before and after refactoring. Students write a paragraph explaining what changed, why it's better, and what trade-offs were made.

activities.title: Warm-Up: 5-Min Sketch
activities.desc: Give a simple problem (Parking Lot or ATM). 5 minutes, draw anything. No pressure — just get ideas on paper. Share and compare approaches.

activities.title: Structured Problem-Solving Framework
activities.desc: Walk through the 5-step LLD interview approach: clarify → identify entities → design classes → add patterns → discuss trade-offs.

activities.title: Full Mock Interview: 35 Min Design
activities.desc: Choose one: Hotel Reservation, Ride Sharing, or Movie Booking. Design the full system: OOP model, persistence, API layer, and scalability notes.

activities.title: Design Presentation & Peer Critique
activities.desc: Each student presents their capstone design for 5 minutes. Peers give structured feedback: 1 strength, 1 improvement, 1 question.
